primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God initiates the manifestation of the Risen Christ to a chosen minority (witnesses) to empower them for world-transformation.

tekstueel_bewijs: God raised him on the third day and made him manifest
God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Spirit and with power
God has chosen you for something more

object.identificatie: The Manifestation of the Risen Life / Salvation
tekstueel_bewijs: participation in that new and risen life
one ordained by God to be judge
not to all the people but to us
you who are here this morning are among those whom God has chosen

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The Name of Jesus
tekstueel_bewijs: The Holy Spirit is the engine of Christian faith
the Holy Spirit will be in your words
healing all that were oppressed by the devil
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely bad habits but 'bondage to sin' and 'the devil,' requiring a divine Subject to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The witnesses testify to the Resurrection in the world.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer / Witness
secundair_narratief_programma.object: The spread of the Gospel / Healing of others
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (witnessing) is explicitly framed as a result of the primary program (being chosen and empowered by God).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God → Risen Life → The Chosen Witnesses

voorbeelden_god_subject: God raised him on the third day
The Holy Spirit of Jesus Christ was drawing you
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Many of you are here because you are members
you stumblingly asked Jesus to heal her

voorbeelden: more will be asked of them
wouldn't you want to come back?
the Holy Spirit is the engine

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the divine endowment of power (Pouvoir) rather than human obligation (Devoir). It assumes the hearer lacks the power and must receive it from the Spirit.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the 'Low Sunday' (Niet-S1) to the reality of Death (S2), then through the Cross (Niet-S2) to the Power of Resurrection (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God's sovereign action in raising Jesus and choosing witnesses, bridging the gap between death and life.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; death is described as a 'sentence' and sin as 'bondage'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the primary actor. Human response is framed as a result of being 'drawn' or 'chosen' by the Spirit.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Tell your children... tell your friends.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The initiative in that matter was his alone.
Do not go out from here... worrying about what you are supposed to do for him in return.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures like Peter and Paul are described as 'nonentities' who were transformed by an external power, not as heroes to emulate by will.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: God uses weak vessels by filling them with the Spirit.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and empowerment; shifting from 'having to do' to 'being used by'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic leanings; salvation and witness are works of God.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'Low Sunday' problem to the 'Power of the Spirit' solution is logically and narratively tight.
spanning_punten: The tension between being 'chosen' (exclusivity) and the universal 'bondage to sin'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: healing all that were oppressed by the devil; world-overturning announcement

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the 'engine' that provides the 'Pouvoir-faire' (ability) to the incompetent subject.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; sin is a power that makes the Cross 'foolishness' to the perishing.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in grace-oriented narrative. God is the Subject of almost all transformative verbs.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a necessary corrective for 'Low Sunday' moralism.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Continue emphasizing that the 'must' (Devoir) is carried by the 'can' (Pouvoir) of the Spirit.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon brilliantly avoids the trap of 'Low Sunday' moralism by reframing attendance and witness as a divine 'drawing' rather than a human duty.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric might focus on the 'Low Sunday' hook, Greimas analysis shows the underlying engine is the Holy Spirit's agency.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Goes beyond the meaning of Acts 10 to show how the preacher assigns the 'Subject' role to God in the contemporary moment.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'witness' is an actant who is a 'Receiver' of power before becoming a 'Subject' of testimony.

volledige_subject_lijst: God (raised, made manifest, anointed, was with, chosen, commanded, acts)
Jesus (went about doing good, rose, displayed wounds, called)
Holy Spirit (drawing, will be in words)
appendices.notities: The sermon follows Fleming Rutledge's rule almost perfectly.
